markdown:
<title level="1" right="Focus 6" pfs="Standard">
[Life-Giving Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=2083)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=623" />
<trait label="Light" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=640" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Vitality" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=509" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 260 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Mystery**
[Life](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=17)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You transcend your physical form, becoming a beacon of healing energy. Your body exudes [bright light](/Rules.aspx?ID=407) like a [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2760). You gain resistance 5 to precision damage and weakness 5 to void damage, and your [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) Strikes deal an extra 1d4 vitality damage.

 You can touch a living creature with an Interact action to restore 6d8 Hit Points to it, and when a creature touches you with an Interact action you can allow it to gain the same healing; either way, the creature becomes temporarily immune to _life-giving form's_ healing for 1 minute. This is a [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) effect. You can't heal yourself with life-giving form. A creature harmed by vitality damage (such as an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722)) that touches you or damages you with an [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) attack or non-[reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=684) melee weapon instead takes 3d4 vitality damage, and it doesn't become temporarily immune.

 You can Dismiss this spell.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The Hit Points restored with an Interact action increases by 1d8, the vitality damage increases by 1, and the resistance and weakness increases by 1.
name: Life-Giving Form

</summary>

text: Life-Giving Form Two Actions Source Player Core 2 pg. 260 1.1 Mystery Life Duration 1 minute --- You transcend your physical form, becoming a beacon of healing energy. Your body exudes bright light like a torch. You gain resistance 5 to precision damage and weakness 5 to void damage, and your unarmed Strikes deal an extra 1d4 vitality damage. You can touch a living creature with an Interact action to restore 6d8 Hit Points to it, and when a creature touches you with an Interact action you can allow it to gain the same healing; either way, the creature becomes temporarily immune to life-giving form's healing for 1 minute. This is a vitality healing effect. You can't heal yourself with life-giving form. A creature harmed by vitality damage (such as an undead) that touches you or damages you with an unarmed attack or non-reach melee weapon instead takes 3d4 vitality damage, and it doesn't become temporarily immune. You can Dismiss this spell. --- Heightened (+1) The Hit Points restored with an Interact action increases by 1d8, the vitality damage increases by 1, and the resistance and weakness increases by 1.
